text: Psalm 43
A Prayer for Rescue
Judge me, O God, and plead my case
against\f + \fr 43:1 \ft Or “because of” \f* an unfaithful\f + \fr 43:1 \ft Or “disloyal” \f* nation.
From a man of deceit and wickedness rescue me,
because you \add are\add* the God of my refuge.
Why have you rejected me?
Why must I go about mourning
because of \add the\add* oppression of \add the\add* enemy?
Send your light and your truth;
they shall lead\f + \fr 43:3 \ft Or “let them lead” \f* me.
They shall bring me to ⸤your holy mountain⸥\f + \fr 43:3 \ft Literally “the mountain of your holiness” \f*
and to your dwelling places.
Then\f + \fr 43:4 \ft Or “And” \f* I will go to the altar of God,
to God, ⸤my surpassing joy⸥,\f + \fr 43:4 \ft Literally “the joy of my gladness” \f*
and I will praise you with lyre,
O God, my God.
Why are you ⸤in despair⸥,\f + \fr 43:5 \ft Literally “bowed down” \f* O my soul?
And why are you disturbed within me?
Hope in God, because I will again praise him,
⸤my salvation⸥\f + \fr 43:5 \ft Hebrew “the salvation of my face” \f* and my God.
